The Secretary will provide funding for veterans education outreach programs at institutions of higher learning. Payments will be made to eligible institutions with at least 50 eligible persons for services. Eligible persons are those receiving educational benefits. The Secretary provides funding for veterans education outreach programs at institutions of higher learning. Eligible institutions must apply to ensure funds are used for this purpose. The applicant for the education outreach program must spend an amount equal to the award from sources other than federal programs and submit required reports to the Secretary. Additionally, they must include policies, assurances, and procedures to protect the financial interests of the United States and maintain an office of veterans' affairs responsible for certification and outreach. The education outreach program for veterans includes certification, outreach, recruitment, and special education programs. It provides counseling and information on various services available to veterans. The submission requirements are determined by the Secretary. The Secretary determines necessary information for institutions of higher learning eligible for funding under this section. Institutions can collaborate through consortium agreements. Approval of applications is contingent on implementing program requirements within the first academic year of receiving payment. Institutions that received funding in fiscal year 1993 under a specific section are included. The Higher Education Act of 1965 allows institutions of higher learning to receive payments based on the number of eligible individuals. The maximum payment to any institution in a different community is $75,000 per fiscal year. The Secretary will distribute payments to approved institutions, with a cap of $100 per person described in the subsection. If funds are insufficient, payments will be distributed proportionally. The Secretary will reduce payments to institutions if funds are insufficient, but will increase them if more funds become available. Payments will be apportioned equitably, and coordination with other Department programs will be ensured for maximum effectiveness. The Secretary retains a small percentage of funds for collecting information on veterans educational outreach programs and administering the section. $3,000,000 is authorized annually for this purpose. Chapter 36 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include a new item after section 3697A. Chapter 36 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include a new item after section 3697A, titled "3697B. Veterans education outreach program." This was passed by the House of Representatives on May 24, 1993.
